TextDecoderStreamEncoding.summary: The encoding read-only property of the interface returns a string containing the name of the encoding algorithm used by the specific decoder.

remarks.para: The encoding is set by the constructor label parameter, and defaults to utf-8.

TextDecoderStreamEncoding.value: A string containing the lower-cased ASCII name of the encoding format.The allowed values are the same as those listed in TextDecoder.encoding (the labels in Encoding API Encodings).

TextDecoderStreamFatal.summary: The fatal read-only property of the interface is a {{jsxref("boolean")}} indicating if the error mode of the TextDecoderStream object is set to fatal.

remarks.para:
If the property is true then a decoder will throw a if it encounters malformed data while decoding.
If false the decoder will substitute the invalid data with the replacement character U+FFFD (ï¿½).
The value of the property is set in the TextDecoderStream() constructor.

TextDecoderStreamFatal.value:
A which will return true if the error mode is set to "fatal".
Otherwise it returns false, indicating that the error mode is "replacement".

TextDecoderStreamIgnoreBOM.summary: The ignoreBOM read-only property of the interface is a {{jsxref('Boolean')}} indicating whether the byte order mark will be included in the output or skipped over.
TextDecoderStreamIgnoreBOM.value: true if the byte order mark will be included in the decoded text; false if it will be skipped over when decoding and omitted.
